quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear – not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Effort and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Courage is being scared to death, but saddling up anyway.
author: John Wayne

quote: The secret to happiness is freedom… and the secret to freedom is courage.
author: Thucydides

quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The greatest test of courage on the earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: R.G. Ingersoll

quote: We must build dikes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: To love is to risk not being loved in return. To hope is to risk pain. To try is to risk failure, but risk must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.
author: Author Unknown

quote: You don't develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
author: Epicurus

quote: Courage is the force that makes our lives brilliant, like a great work of art.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: Scared is what you’re feeling. Brave is what you’re doing.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: Life is not about living the safer option. Life is about living a life worth living.
author: Robert Thier

quote: Braveness is not the absence of fear but rather the strength to keep on going forward despite the fear.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: He who is brave is free.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: We must become bigger than we have been: more courageous, greater in spirit, larger in outlook.
author: Haile Selassie

quote: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.
author: Jim Hightower

quote: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Bravery never goes out of fashion.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Courage is about learning how to function despite the fear, to put aside your instincts to run or give in completely to the anger born from fear.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: A brave man acknowledges the strength of others.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Courage doesn't happen when you have all the answers. It happens when you are ready to face the questions you have been avoiding your whole life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: It takes a lot of courage to release the familiar and seemingly secure, to embrace the new.
author: Alan Cohen

quote: Fate loves the fearless.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee

quote: If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
author: John Irving

quote: To see the right and not do it is cowardice.
author: Confucius

quote: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Courage is not the absence of despair; it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.
author: Rollo May

quote: If you could get up the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed.
author: David Viscott

quote: Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma – which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards; they simply unveil them to the eyes of men.
author: Brooke Foss Westcott

quote: True courage is being afraid, and going ahead and doing your job anyhow, that's what courage is.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We ought to face our destiny with courage.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Taking a new step, uttering a new word, is what people fear most.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: The strangest, most generous, and proudest of all virtues is true courage.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice. Have the courage to follow your own heart and intuition.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Courage is the commitment to begin without any guarantee of success.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the assessment that something else is more important than fear.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Heroes are never perfect, but they're brave, they're authentic, they're courageous, determined, discreet, and they've got grit.
author: Wade Davis

quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Freedom lies in bold action.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Choose courage over comfort.
author: Brené Brown

quote: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Nobody learns what he can do except by trying.
author: Seneca

quote: Either life entails courage, or it ceases to be life.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
author: Plato

quote: Choose the great adventure of being brave and afraid. At the exact same time.
author: Brené Brown

quote: At the root of most fear is what other people will think of us.
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: We must let go of the life we've planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: If we did the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Our deepest fears are like dragons guarding our deepest treasure.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The terrorists thought they would change our aims and stop our ambitions, but nothing changed in my life but this: weakness, fear, and hopelessness died; strength, power and courage were born.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quote: The scared freeze. The brave try.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Courage is the only virtue you can’t fake.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

quote: Vulnerability is our most accurate measurement of courage.
author: Brené Brown

quote: It’s possible to transcend anything that doesn’t kill you.
author: David Goggins

quote: Courage is the birthplace of confidence.
author: Debbie Millman

quote: The stronger your principles, the more you’ll fight for them.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Getting over yourself offers exponential returns.
author: Shane Parrish

quote: Courage is a muscle.
author: Brian Norgard

quote: A king is one who fears nothing.
author: Seneca

quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
author: Aristotle

quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: The brave man inattentive to his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Self-reflection encourages great bravery. Rationalization is your greatest enemy.
author: Awa Kenzo

quote: Let us conduct ourselves so that all men wish to be our friends and all fear to be our enemies.
author: Alexander the Great
